newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lanka's 1996 GDP growth at prov. 3.8 percent.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka's 1996 GDP growth at prov. 3.8 percent.

text.p: Sri Lanka's gross domestic Product (GDP) grew a provisional 3.8 percent last year against a 5.5 percent growth in 1995, the Central Bank said in its annual report released on Wednesday.
"The economy displayed remarkable resilience under difficult circumstances," said the report, a copy of which was obtained by Reuters.
A prolonged dorught depressed agricultural production and also curtailed hydropower generation while a few incidents of urban terrorism hit business confidence, it said.
